metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1420 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
On desktop, Ubuntu UI Toolkit's StateSaver would serialise data on tmp/ files which an attacker could use to expose potentially sensitive data. StateSaver would also open files without the O_EXCL flag. An attacker could exploit this to launch a symlink attack, though this is partially mitigated by symlink and hardlink restrictions in Ubuntu. Fixed in 1.1.1188+14.10.20140813.4-0ubuntu1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1420` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libubuntugestures5 - 1.1.1188+14.10.20140813.4-0ubuntu1
libubuntutoolkit5 - 1.1.1188+14.10.20140813.4-0ubuntu1
qml-module-ubuntu-components - 1.1.1188+14.10.20140813.4-0ubuntu1
qml-module-ubuntu-layouts - 1.1.1188+14.10.20140813.4-0ubuntu1
qml-module-ubuntu-performancemetrics - 1.1.1188+14.10.20140813.4-0ubuntu1
qml-module-ubuntu-test - 1.1.1188+14.10.20140813.4-0ubuntu1
qtdeclarative5-ubuntu-ui-toolkit-plugin - 1.1.1188+14.10.20140813.4-0ubuntu1
ubuntu-app-launch-profiler - 1.1.1188+14.10.20140813.4-0ubuntu1
ubuntu-ui-toolkit-autopilot - 1.1.1188+14.10.20140813.4-0ubuntu1
ubuntu-ui-toolkit-examples - 1.1.1188+14.10.20140813.4-0ubuntu1
ubuntu-ui-toolkit-theme - 1.1.1188+14.10.20140813.4-0ubuntu1
ubuntu-ui-toolkit-tools - 1.1.1188+14.10.20140813.4-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> desktop only. On Touch apps are confined by apparmor and use their own application-specific TMP area

criterions.comment: ubuntu-ui-toolkit package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.1188+14.10.20140813.4-0ubuntu1').
